review_content: I love Charlotte Tilbury blushes. They are the best powder blush texture I have ever used. I love Pillow Talk if I’m wearing a lot of eye makeup or a more colourful lip. It goes with everything. Looks a bit rosy on me although it’s nude.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Got sucked in by the hype around CT and her products so of course I went for what people were raving about. It’s a good product, very pigmented and blends effortlessly which is great. Packaging is stunning and lux. Beautiful. However the colour is generic imo but I do like the outer ring the best. Wish the entire pan was that colour. Also, I did not expect that much kick up from a product at this price range. Reminds me of Colourpop’s pressed blushes. Definitely returning this but I will try this range in another shade.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I wasn't sure if this would show up on my skin. Pillow talk is definitely a subtle everyday, nude color on my med-tan (NC37-40) skin. it is a very fine powder and goes on very smooth and gives a lovely healthy glow. I am not one for extreme sheen and glitter on my face. Being of a "certain age" this is great for mature skin and does not exaggerate texture on the skin. The only con for me is having the light color in the center for highlighting or blending edges. I would prefer the lighter color be separated on one side to allow the brush fit in the darker blush color similar to the ND blushes. I would purchase this color again and most likely purchase one of the other colors. Definitely worth the splurge during Sephora's sales.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Charlotte Tilbury’s blushes are some of my favorites, and I definitely don’t use them as often as I should. I have a pretty big blush collection, and it’s easy for me to forget what I own if I don’t have it in front of me. Anyway, I love how natural these blushes look on me — I have Pillow Talk and Ecstasy. I rarely ever use them the way they were intended to be, which is by using the outer, larger ring as your main blush color and using the inner circle to either deepen your cheeks or to highlight (depending on which blush in the collection you own). Most blush brushes are too big to do that, so I just swirl both shades in the compact and use them as one color. Speaking of the compact, I find it very stylish and just the right size for keeping in a purse. It’s not as sturdy as I’d like considering the price of Tilbury products, but it’s not super weak and flimsy either. Overall, I recommend these for sure.
…read more

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
They just got started selling this in-store where I live and I went to see what "Pillow Talk" was all about as I have heard so much about it. I loved to color and decided to buy it. When I applied it, the look is so natural and healthy. It looks like I am blushing, but nothing more. It subtly enhances my cheekbones and it was a nice luminescent finish - yet not too much. The finished look is gorgeous. It doesn't irritate my skin and it is so silky smooth. I love this blush and I look forward to trying more of CT products. Lipstick here I come!

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great blush to build your desired effect
review_content:
I read so many reviews about the blushes being delicate and braking easily that I decided to buy this in store and not risk it with shipping. My first impression about most of the blushes I saw on display was that the colors did not look at all like the online pictures. Some were so light looking that I mistook it for face powder. I wanted ecstasy but it looked so pale and chalky. I decided on Pillowtalk and yes, its more brownish looking but still nice. It goes well mixed with my bronzer. I like the nude-ish type of color instead of my usual coral blush. Like another reviewer said, at first I had to adjust to this type of color but after some uses, I came to like it alot. Minus one star since the highlighter in the middle makes it really hard to avoid it if I am using a thicker brush. If alot of highlighter is on the brush, it can emphasize my pores on the cheek.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection

review_content:
I have medium skin with more neutral, seasonally slightly gold/olive toned and finding a blush that isn't too pink, too red, too orange, too peach is extremely difficult. For some reason I bought into the hype and got Pillow Talk and have to say it's the perfect blush colour. Gives my skin a flush of colour (a muted bronzy rose) without being overpowering. It's not matte but it's not shimmery. Personally I don't like the highlighter / cheek shade, but I can live with it.

product_name: Charlotte Tilbury Cheek to Chic Blush - Pillow Talk Collection
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
Lovely, sleep packaging! I like the blush color for fair to even medium skin tones. I am fair and it almost makes me look like I have a flushed but subtle tan. This imparts sheer color, so is well suited for a beginner as it would be harder to over-apply compared to other highly pigmented blushes. The highlight color is very subtle, and again good for mature folks who don't want a blinding stripe or flecks of glitter on their face. On my fair skin and over the blush, the highlight shifts very slightly gold or champagne, but is not too dark. If one does try to build up the highlight, they may instead see a gold powdery area instead of an amped-up glow. I feel this could probably be duped with less expensive blush colors from many lines, and the subtlety of the highlight may frustrate many who like to wear a highlighter. On me, this duo imparted a nice, healthy sheer radiance rather than a dewy glow. Sort of like the difference between a matte and satin or slightly dewy foundation. No wet looks or sparkle here. That being said, I think I paid too much for this because it's in the CT line. I knew this going in, but feel I've obtained better values in other less pricey products for the performance.
